title: OW2 Season 4
text: The objective of this project is to identify win rates of OW2 characters based on statistics in the game. The data used for this project came from Kaggle, submitted by a data analyst working for Team 4 at Activision Blizzard (OW2 Team). The data, submitted after the conclusion of Season 4, is the most accurate available without directly working for Team 4. The model used for this project is a causal model, modeling the variable win_rate as a function of many different statistical factors present in OW2. Using metrics such as K/D/A ratio, pick rates, eliminations per 10 minutes, damage per 10 minutes, healing per 10 minutes, and deaths per 10 minutes, we will try to predict win rates based on these factors.

title: Sources
text:
The data used for this project came from Kaggle. The user that input this data is a data analyst that works for team 4 at Activision Blizzard (OW2 Team). They had submitted this data after the conclusion of season 4 making the data the most accurate data that can be found wiithout working direcctly for team 4.
The meta compositions featured from OWL in this project were collected from the OWL Midseason Madness Tournament which took place at the end of Season 4 of OW2.

title: Model
text:
The formula used for the model is \[ \text{win_rate} = \beta_0 + \text{elim_rate} \beta_1 + \text{death_rate} \beta_2 + \text{KDA} \beta_3 + \text{pick_rate} \beta_4 + \text{dmg_rate} \beta_5 + \text{heal_rate} \beta_6 \]

As seen in the table above we can see that win rate is most affected by KDA and death_rate, while least affected by dmg_rate and heal_rate.


 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = identity 
Formula: win_rate ~ elim_rate + death_rate + KDA + pick_rate + dmg_rate + heal_rate 
   Data: x (Number of observations: 80) 
  Draws: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup draws = 4000

Regression Coefficients:
           Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept    -10.62      7.68   -25.75     4.74 1.00     1672     2071
elim_rate     -0.90      0.28    -1.46    -0.35 1.00     1955     2318
death_rate     5.84      0.82     4.22     7.45 1.00     1765     2081
KDA            4.50      0.60     3.30     5.62 1.00     2397     2114
pick_rate      0.76      0.09     0.58     0.93 1.00     2460     2344
dmg_rate       0.00      0.00    -0.00     0.00 1.00     2675     2696
heal_rate      0.00      0.00    -0.00     0.00 1.00     3534     3002

Further Distributional Parameters:
      Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
sigma     2.43      0.21     2.07     2.87 1.00     2794     2589

Draws were sampled using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
